list_definition.definition: a building with simple accommodation, especially for young people, hikers etc
a building where students etc may live

list_ex_of_english: The skinheads attacked one of the refugee hostels and the people had to run up to the roof.
We are carrying out the first major expansion in the building of modern hostels for many years.
On the second part of the question, we are hoping to open further hostels for alcoholics.
As these hostels were never intended to be self-supporting, would he put the charges back to the original figure?
I feel it is important that these hostels should be designed very carefully for the type of people who are going to use them.
The sensitivity of the ovary to living arrangements became even clearer when the 49 students living in flats and hostels were separated from the 49 who lived with relatives.
We need residential hostels for the autistic for their own sake and for the sake of their parents.
I am advised that the hostels could not easily be converted into working class dwellings.
